headline: President Trump trashed by US media during UK visit
subHeadline: Trump blasts the 'corrupt media' for not being fair; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everybody. I am Jesse Watters along with Kennedy, Juan Williams, Dana Perino and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City. And this is "The Five." President Trump taking time during his visit to the U.K. to sit down for a candid interview with Piers Morgan on the Good Morning Britain Show. He opened up about his trip, conversations with the Queen, and how his late mother would have reacted.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: I will say that my mother would have been very proud. She was a tremendous fan of this country. And she was -- she loves Scotland. She grew up there. She loves the Royals. She loves the Queen.  And I always notice whenever anything was on about the Queen, she would watch. She was a big fan.

utterances.speaker: PIERS MORGAN, GOOD MORNING BRITAIN HOST
utterances.sentences: Did you tell the Queen?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I told her last night. She was very honored. We had a great rapport. We had -- we had a conversation that lasted for an hour and a half nonstop.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He also took a moment to clarify a controversial comment about Meghan Markle, the Duchess of Sussex.

utterances.speaker: MORGAN
utterances.sentences: Is Meghan Markle a business?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MORGAN
utterances.sentences: Do you think Meghan Markle is nasty or not?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No. You know, the question was asked to me. And I didn't know that she said anything bad about me. It sounds like she did. And it's OK. I mean, they joined the crowd, right. You've heard about that, too, with yourself. I know that, right. But it seems like she had. And they said some of the things that she said. And it's actually on tape. And I'm I said, well, I didn't know she was nasty. I wasn't referring to her. I said she was nasty about me. And essentially, I didn't know she was nasty about me. So I said, but, you know what, she's doing a good job. I hope she enjoys her life.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Obviously, the President's trip was covered heavily here in the United States. Trump blasting the, quote, corrupt media for not being fair. Those comments not without merit. Let's look at the stark difference in how the British media is covering the President compared to the U.S. media. U.K. outlets opting for more positive headlines touting Trump's praise of eternal friendship, common values, and the treasured friendship between the U.S. and the U.K. But the U.S. media, they just can't seem to help themselves. Once again, going on the attack.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Narcissism don't mix well with diplomacy, who knew.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The Brits absolutely know how to troll the President. They know how to get under his skin. And they did it with -- you know, with style, with spectacle.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He likes the idea of being a king.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Perhaps he likes the idea of being a king.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: He's walking around like he wants to be the king. That sounds like he's the king. He is just saying you know, his subjects do this, do this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Dana, I mean, I think it's clear why the British media likes it when the U.S. President comes because it solidifies the relationship between the two countries that have a lot in common.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, if you think, you know, following British politics over the past year, it's not been easy. Now, they have a prime minister leaving, they have a new election, they haven't done Brexit. It's like a big mess.  And then, for the last several days, they are the host to the Leader of the Free World. It could not have gone better, I think, from the U.K.'s perspective,

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, very smooth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And also from the White House's perspective. They had a great time. And I think that a lot of this for the U.S. media, it's prebaked that the President is going to have a bad trip.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He's going to screw something up. He's going to have a domestic problem back home. And that's actually kind of not happened. Of course, you know Peter is British. He said there is more of a groundswell of support for President Trump in Britain that a lot of times people who wanted to leave the European Union get ignored in the media. It's a very similar story.  And that they wish that Theresa May had been a little bit more like President Trump when she was fighting with the E.U. about leaving, because she kept trying to like accommodate and they don't want to accommodate Europe anymore.  So I don't know where it goes from here, but I do think that the U.K. had a very successful visit. And the President has a lot to be proud of. And there is still more to come.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg, I would like to take this opportunity to play some video for you of the President trying on a hat.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MORGAN
utterances.sentences: We would like to present you with a Churchill hat.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I never knew you had that kind of sensibility. Let me try this on.

utterances.speaker: MORGAN
utterances.sentences: Please try it on. That would be great.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: It's a little big.

utterances.speaker: MORGAN
utterances.sentences: Let me get that. That's fantastic.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Let's see how this looks. I think -- I think Churchill.

utterances.speaker: MORGAN
utterances.sentences: It's a Winston Trump.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I think Winston looked much better in it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What do you think about the hat, Greg? Would you have done that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He should be wearing a black hat because he's a villain. Hey, I never liked Piers Morgan when he's on CNN, but I like him on that show. So, it's definitely CNN.   Let's talk about the delusion, the news delusion. There was one of the women in the montage that said the Brits really know how to get it under his skin. So that's a delusion. She -- there was never any sign that anything was under his skin.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But she sees it in her head and projects it. That's a delusion.   There's an article on CNN's website that we all got sent around, 31 quotes from Donald Trump. After each quote, his head was exploding. You could hear him pulling at his hair going oh, my God, he's like the neighbor from Bewitched, right. He's going absolutely nuts.  So, this is -- when you focus on the words, you create your very own mental health problem that nobody else can see. If you focus on the deeds, however, what's going on with trade, jobs, GDP, North Korea, China, what we are doing with opioids, our military strength, this is a golden age. If you keep focusing on the words, you end up having these delusions like you do on CNN and like this young woman on that other show. Also, I would like to say that I have said before that Trump is a news potato. You can make him into any meal, French fries, you can also make him into Shepherd's Pie because he served it up. He served it up. He had a hearty blend of news and entertainment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, what would you make the President into, if you are playing the Mr. Potato Head game?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Wow, Shepherd's Pie. You are sophisticated guy, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I like Shepherd's Pie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Shepherd's Pie is disgusting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's not what you think, by the way.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The thing is I guess I saw this a little differently because I read where the President was talking to Theresa May about well, you know, we could have a trade deal with the U.S. And we will include the British healthcare system, which absolutely set here a fire in Britain. People go what, he wants to bring American private enterprise into our much beloved you know public-sector healthcare system. So I think people were upset about that.  And with the Meghan Markle stuff, he says he was talking about her comment. I just say is this a kind of difference without distinction? Because I think he has a history of calling people like Hillary Clinton a nasty woman, right. He said this about Senator Elizabeth Warren. He said this about Kamala Harris. He says Omarosa is a dog. He says Rosie O'Donnell is a dog. I know how this guy talks and speaks about people who are critical or have strong differences with him. So to me, you know...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, he says that about men, too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right. OK, so that's my point. So, in other words, she's the kind of person who makes nasty comments to him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He has to read it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. But I just think that you guys say everything went so smoothly, but I think you look at the protests, he says, he never saw it. He saw people cheering he said. Oh, but I see that they have thousands of people...

utterances.speaker: LISA KENNEDY MONTGOMERY, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: The protests weren't that big. I mean, in all fairness...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: As compared to what they might've been.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK. Good point.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: And considering the outrage and the point...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And the buildup by the media.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: That the mayor of London was making, you would think the entire country was dead set against this President. And he is as bad as Hitler. And that was the subtext of Sadiq Khan's op-ed that he wrote saying Britain should not be rolling out the red carpet for this President.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: But what I want to point out kind of in contrast is how you feel about the President and how he has jostled the world stage. And U.S. politics are very dynamic, very, very fluid. We know we may have a new President in a year and a half. But we may have the same President for another five and a half years. But someone who's been there through many administrations is the Queen.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: And you have to look at her reaction. And her reaction was not one of disgust, or disdain, or snobbery. She was truly giddy. And she obviously enjoyed being in his presence because she knows this too shall pass and not to get too wrapped up and too emotional and too reactive to this figure who has created all sorts of emotional reactions from people on both sides of hatred and beloved for the President.  And I really enjoyed watching her. Because I don't think she was trolling him, I think she had a great time. And I think she's at a point in her life where you know from Eisenhower to Trump, she has seen the political gambit run here in the United States.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't think -- you thought she might be trolling him?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: No. I think that was the point of one of the first commenters from the U.S. saying well, the Brits really know how to control the President. That wasn't trolling. That was someone who's been through it, who has perspective, who actually had a pretty good time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. Yes, Kennedy knows trolling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I am actually a troll. I live under a bridge.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And same size.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was a joke. Thanks for explaining my joke.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, just the bridge comment. Because he's very short, everyone. Climate change is making the Democratic candidates nuts. Greg breaks it down next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just days before the 75th anniversary of D-Day, Elizabeth Warren said climate change is a bigger threat than whatever happened back then.

utterances.speaker: SEN. ELIZABETH WARREN (D), MASSACHUSETTS
utterances.sentences: Americans faced huge challenges before, World War II, put a man on the moon. This environmental catastrophe bearing down on us may be the biggest challenge yet.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Bigger than World War II. Imagine if she had been President on D- Day. Let's call it off, the sea horses might die. She would put the whole thing on hold until they fix the emissions in the Sherman tanks. So climate change is worse than Hitler? Could be since just the thought makes me fume. So after getting hammered for appropriating Native Americanism, Liz now wants to be AOC, as the other Democrats realize that blaming Trump for everything in good times is essentially crediting him for the good times. So, now, it's back to climate doom. But if they believe we will destroy earth if we don't act drastically, shouldn't they be disabling planes, trains, and automobiles instead of using them? What hypocrites.  And what broken records, apocalyptic thinking has been around forever. The World War was supposed to end on a million yesterdays. Yet, the left keeps resurrecting that one thought. We are all going to die. But it raises a huge question. If the left can't come up with a way to solve terror, crime, or homelessness, why should we listen to them about a problem that's the size of the earth? There were 144,000 arrests on the southern border last month. You don't want to solve that little problem? Then shut up about the earth. You are in over your head. But issues are always hampered by hysteria, especially when it is delivered like a champ from a doomsday cult. Climate change may be an existential threat, but only to the sanity of Democrats. You know, Kennedy, the Democrats could've solved immigration in a lunch hour, but couldn't. But I guess climate changes easier.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Well, it's easier because all you have to do is take a bunch of money from people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: And then appropriate -- it's just another redistribution scheme. But the interesting thing about Elizabeth Warren is she only has one way of taking money from rich people. There's only one mechanism for doing that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Yet, it's almost like a badly -- a badly run Ponzi scheme because she is taking that money from the rich people, but she's promising it to about five different programs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: With no new revenue streams. So there's one central revenue stream. She's going to use that to pay for college, for universal pre-K, and pay for all sorts of child care up to the age of five. And she's going to just sock it to rich people one time. And also have a $5 trillion climate change plan that picks winners and losers that will magically somehow not be corrupt at all with a brand of bureaucracy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Jesse, I have a theory. Would you like to hear it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Please.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think the Democrats are pretty good at identifying problems. But it's the Republicans would have to solve them. So when you don't have the Republicans there, you end up with homelessness in L.A. County. So you can say, oh, my God, there's homelessness, but you aren't including the people that can actually solve the problems, which is -- which is the private sector.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know, I would say the Democrats create the problems, blame the Republicans, and then say elect me and I will fix the problem that I created. I have another theory.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The Green New Deal is just a sales pitch for socialism. If you put green in front of something, it sounds better. Like you know green travel, green lifestyle.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Green Hornet.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Green Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Automatically, it makes you seem healthier, more sophisticated and modern and better. But what it really is...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Green beans.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. It's just an excuse for them to tax more and to spend more. And what they do is they want to complete takeover of the economy and your life. And then, they justified by saying, oh, we're going to save the world doing it. But what really is happening is like you said, a total redistribution. What are they going to do? They are going to take a trillion dollars and then they're going to fix some donor who owns a wind farm and give him 5 million. Then the biggest algae firm in her home state of Massachusetts, they get a couple million dollars. And then, you know, they give a contract of the solar panel company, and they re-outfit the entire Department of Justice. It's like Solyndra on steroids. It's green graft is what it really is. And so, Elizabeth Warren gets up there. All she's done in her whole life, she flipped one house for a small profit and wrote a fake Indian cookbook. And you're going to put her in charge of a $19 trillion economy. She's not Warren Buffett.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think graft does not sound better with the word green in front of it. Might be the only word.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, I have another theory. Should I post it to you or Juan.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Juan, so, Biden is getting hammered for plagiarizing parts of his green deal. I think it was a great strategy because he got people to actually read it. You had to compare the passages. So in effect, their media read it twice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's good point. You know what I think, though, to me, it's incredible, but you said it right. Republicans just don't register on this. They don't want to seem to acknowledge that there's any problem.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They should.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But they don't.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: A similar plan to AOC.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: When you look at the numbers. Not Matt Gaetz but anybody. I look at the numbers, 77 percent of Democrats are strongly concerned about climate change. But only 52 percent of Republicans are skeptical.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's about right for America.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But here's the thing. Guess what, the top priority for Democratic voters, healthcare, number two far behind but still number two.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The economy?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, climate change. Guess what and especially...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So you are saying Democrats are delusional.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no, younger Democrats -- the millennials think it's the number one issue.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: That is true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's because they are the least knowledgeable on other issues.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't think so. I think these are people who think this is going to impact me in my lifetime. And I don't like it. So you get Joe Biden...

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Be more positive about it. Stop being on doomsday about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have to get Dana in it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jay Inslee's number one issue, Beto O'Rourke, number one priority.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. You know, Dana, the problem is the rhetoric becomes white noise.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. OK, Bjorn Lomborg who is a wonderful climate scientist...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He has done a research. It was just last week in the Wall Street Journal that he wrote another piece about overblown rhetoric about climate change actually hurts the problem because they go too far. The other thing is that was interesting we just learned this week, Germany had climate targets, right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The carbon reduction targets. They're not meeting them. Do you know why?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They closed their nuclear pants.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So they can't meet their energy needs and reduce their carbon emissions because they made bad policy decisions on something that was actually greener.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And also, I think Americans are smart enough to realize we can do a lot here. We should innovate, we should do all these things, nuclear, carbon capture, all those things. But if the rest of the world isn't doing that as well...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It won't have a net effect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is so true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But then, we have to set the example.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We do, with nuclear.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: I agree with you there. Innovation -- private innovation is one thing. Government force is another. That will take our economy. And it doesn't do anything about China.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: France is doing pretty good with nuclear.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We've got to move on. I get it, I get it, I get it. Remember Scot Peterson, sheriff deputy who stood outside while a gunman opened fire inside a school in Parkland. Well, now, he is facing justice, the details ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Former Broward County Sheriff's Deputy Scot Peterson who stayed outside the building when a gunman opened fire inside Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School last February, he has been arrested. And now, he is facing criminal charges, including child neglect, culpable negligence, and perjury. Following a 15-month investigation, authorities say Peterson, quote, did absolute nothing, end quote, to prevent the shooting and, quote, there can be no excuse for his complete inaction and no question that his inaction cost lives. In an interview a few months after the tragedy, Peterson defended his actions.

utterances.speaker: SCOT PETERSON, FORMER FLORIDA DEPUTY
utterances.sentences: Families need to know I didn't get it right, but it wasn't because of some oh, I don't want to go into that building. Oh, I don't want to face somebody in there. It wasn't like that at all.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You weren't scared?

utterances.speaker: PETERSON
utterances.sentences: No. There was no time. Things went so fast.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's -- you know, it sounds like a real human being. I am wondering, given that Ron DeSantis, the new governor, campaigned on this issue, I'm wondering if this is being held out a sort of a political scapegoat. Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: Well, I think you put yourself in that position. He was the police officer at the school for nine years. He had a 30-year plus career in law enforcement and the majority of that was spent protecting schools. And as you know since Columbine, every single one of these officers across country and especially in Florida where you have these very densely populated high schools where these kids are sitting ducks, they get an incredible amount of training. And law enforcement agencies across the country and particularly in these big schools are very, very vigilant about administering that training. So for him say that everything went so fast he wasn't scared, that's not really what happened. Anyone who's been through one of these incredibly traumatic events, especially in law enforcement, knows that time slows down, but also your training allows you to account for that. And I'm pretty sure his training didn't tell him to go hide by a stairwell and then lie about it. And if I were one of the parents of the injured or one of the 17 kids who died because of his inaction, this is -- this is only moderately satisfying.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jesse, he was armed. But he thought he said that the shooting was coming from outside. And now, it's going to be up to a jury to make a very difficult determination. What did he know at the time?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's a lie because you have the audio recordings of him on the walkie-talkie saying the shooting is coming from inside the building. So we know he lied. And I spoke to Meadow's father today, Andrew Pollack, crusading for school safety reform. And he said it's been a long time coming and credit to Rick Scott, the governor, for initiating the investigation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no. Ron DeSantis is the governor.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. Governor Rick Scott began this when he was the governor and started the investigation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And then, DeSantis, as you said, campaigned on accountability. And he fired Israel who trained, quote, unquote this guy. And Andrew Gillum was the Democrat candidate who campaigned with Israel. We know this guy lied. And if he had said when the first responders came in, the shooting is from the inside, he would've had to have gone in. But he was too scared. So he acted confused and that's why everybody set-up a perimeter, and that's the exact opposite of what his training told him to do. Now, Florida has passed a new law that says that people, if they volunteer in these schools, they can get training to arm themselves, and that the President's commission to study this. And they're getting rid of Obama's diversionary program where students can get like four or five misdemeanors per year and not get reported to police and get to stay in the school. Because that was one of the reasons this guy was able to run wild. He was a total lunatic and was allowed to stay in school with all these innocent kids where he should have been put somewhere else.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana, one of the thoughts that occurs to me, because I fear that this is a political prosecution is that there's one person responsible here, and that's the alleged murderer.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, and he also is going to spend his life in prison if not, get the death penalty there in Florida. So, this guy is trained, and he is armed, and he's unable to take action or decides not to take action. He is going to have to pay the price for that.  The wheels of justice are slow. Since then, we know that there have been other attempts at mass shootings, including at schools, where other students unarmed, but also training to be Junior ROTC officers or some sort of military junior officer, they are the ones who stopped the shooter out of bravery. And that's really remarkable. They weren't armed, and they were able to prevent it. So I can see why the parents are so very upset.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think the person that is getting, I mean, scot free, literally is Scott Israel. I mean, I kind of agree with Juan. I do think that maybe this guy is being a fall guy for a multitude of failures.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A multitude. We'd like -- to Jesse's point, this could have been prevented. Police knew the fiend was screaming for help by his actions.  He was visited countless times. And this jackass goes on CNN and plays for the applause lines. It was despicable what he was doing up there. He was doing it, even though I believe -- and this is an opinion -- that it's his negligence that is responsible for a lot of this. Perhaps this guy is guilty, but I think that it's not enough, you know, it's not enough. There has to be -- something has to be done. Also, I mean, the guy did it -- well, anyway, I'm just -- I don't understand why that guy is not in jail.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I don't understand why there's not more satisfaction, that there's some accountability somewhere. Because oftentimes, and when these things happen, or there's police involved shootings, people are really upset that police officers aren't convicted and they're rarely charged. And you know, when they're tried, oftentimes in front of a jury of their peers, they get off and that fills people with rage. It also makes people very mad when they're not charged. When some of these circumstances are very suspect, and it's clear what happened here. He had a gun. He could have stopped the other guy with the gun. He could have saved lives. That was his job. And that's why the whole thing --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So many people though should be okay with this because he didn't use his gun. Because a lot of people don't want to have guns at schools.  Right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Okay, that's the --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Well, that's because to prove the point that when there is an armed officer who can stop somebody in a gun free zone.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, he didn't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He didn't use it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He didn't. But to your point, so what would you say to him then? Would you say because you thought the fire was coming from somewhere else?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: If I was one of those parents, I'd say, "Shame on you," and --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Go to jail?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: This is your job. This is your job to protect these kids. He wasn't a hall monitor. He wasn't a librarian. He wasn't a guidance counselor. He was a police officer with a gun and with a training --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But what you were saying, normally, conservatives would say ...

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: He was there to protect the children.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: " ...we think police officers have such a difficult job, we don't want to step in and make judgments for them," and you know, like Monday morning quarterbacks, but here you are.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Oh, I've made plenty of judgments.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's a clear case of negligence. If you're trained to go inside and neutralize a mass shooter inside the building, when you're on the radio saying the shooting is coming from inside the building. And then you wait for 48 minutes outside and then lie to the first responders and say set up a perimeter.  That's as clear as it gets.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: But we learned so much from Columbine and unfortunately, all the mass shootings we've had since then.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm all set. I think we've got to go right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Greg, you've got a thought?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I'm good.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right, "The Daily Beast" and Facebook under fire for exposing the identity of a Trump supporter they say was responsible for creating the now infamous fake Nancy Pelosi video. We've got the details on THE FIVE, next.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: "The Daily Beast" and Facebook facing intense backlash and potential legal trouble after a man claims they doxxed him, revealing his personal identity and information as the person behind a fake Nancy Pelosi video that portrays the House Speaker as though she were drunk. The man denying he is responsible for the video and setting up a legal action fund with plans to sue the individuals and organizations who shared his information. Is it fair game when you put something like this out for the other side who feels like they have been wronged to hurt you by letting the world know who you are?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think it's fair. I mean, this guy put out something that went viral, and so a lot of people saw this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a crime?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I'm saying a lot of people saw what was essentially fake.  Right? I think it is fake.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A parody.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It is absolutely fake. Greg says parody. I think that if you look back at something like, remember Mitt Romney and the 47 percent video that somebody secretly taped, if that had been faked, and then put out and it influenced an election, people say, "Wow, that's not cool. Don't do that." Even if you say it was a parody, I say "Oh, no. People believed it." And so I think this is damaging, and I think going towards 2020, and the idea that we're going to have deep fakes and lots of things done by not only the Russians, but domestically, I think it's really important that people call them out and say don't do it. And if you do it, we're going to hold you accountable. We're going to say who you are and what you did.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Is that the right way to call someone out though?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, I don't believe so. It's the old media gatekeepers, the old guard, they've lost control of the message. They've lost control of the narrative because now anybody, any one of us can go online and manipulate technology and video and it's kind of evened the playing field, so they're scared. The reason it went viral is because there was a kernel of truth to it.  Pelosi has lost a step and people thought it was funny.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh come on, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, people have noticed Nancy Pelosi is not as smooth as she used to be. So that's why it went viral. And instead of CNN or any of these other companies talking about that, they want to dox and shame and humiliate some black conservative who lives in the Bronx. The media does this all the time, Juan. Look at Conan O'Brien. He puts Trump's face up, the lips move and they do a little mouth over whatever.  "The Daily Show" or "The Colbert Report" made millions of dollars on deceptively edited satirical videos that went viral and everybody got a big kick out of it. Hard news media does it, too. CNN deceptively edited the video of President Trump feeding the fish in Japan to make him look undiplomatic.  How about when "Time" magazine darkened O.J.'s mug shot on their cover?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That was my Master's Degree.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Or how about "The Washington Post" tweeting out a picture of an empty gymnasium to make Trump's crowd look small when that was three hours before everybody showed what up? And that's not even getting into all the hoaxes they've promoted. The Russia collusion, the Smollett -- all of that stuff. And you know, speaking of deception, Robert Muller actually edited out some exculpatory information from a phone call from Trump's lawyers to make him look bad. So it happens all the time on that side, but the press doesn't like it when an average American does it.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: But I think you know, obviously, it's a tool of behavioral control. Because if you're worried that someone is going to put out your personal details, you're going to think twice about putting something out there. But that's what the Chinese government does with dissidents, except they disappear and then you never know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, one of the things that could help this for everybody is -- I'm not saying that we should do it -- but to Jesse's point, like he lists all those places that did that, well, you knew where those videos were made, right? So perhaps an electronic signature or something like a little copyright thing, or if you want credit for the photographs, you know, we've got to call and get permission to use videos and things like that. Perhaps that's something that could be added.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: And it's not just Russia, that's having all the fun with this meme-ry. Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.Great. Yes, I was an editor for a number of magazines, I never would have ran this story, because I would have felt kind of gross going after the powerless. Journalists are always about targeting the powerful, not some dude in the Bronx, you know, and exposing him. The media, however is now more than just a journalist and enterprise, it is its own its own political party.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Okay, but what's the difference between parody and really attacking someone? What's the line? Because I'm sure this guy thought "Oh, I'm going to make a video over Nancy Pelosi the drunk."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I think that it doesn't matter to the media because they have a side. So if you -- if "The Daily Beast" partners with Media Matters for America, they're going to put Joe McCarthy to shame. They're going to target you and what constitutes a target is the expanding bullseye of demonization is anything thing not in the resistance, so that's why you can go after a kid in a red hat. Right? Covington -- the Covington kid was an easy target. A forklift operator, itinerant forklift, now he by posting a video parody is now a target. You can target anybody. Kavanaugh, the media galvanizes its forces because they know they can incite fear among companies in the hopes that they fire you or they ban you and the media knows that this is wrong, but they never admit it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And you know Facebook allowed this guy's private information to get out there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's gross to me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They said, "Okay, here I'll give you everything you want."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Was this label parody? No. Was this --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm smart enough to know.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I mean, do you have to label things parody?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Whose lips are moving -- you apparently believed that the guy whose lips were moving was actually the President.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, some random guy wants to play a joke video online and put it out there, you have the entire mainstream media descend on this guy?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: In other words --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know how many Trump memes are out there that people retweet.  I've never CNN go expose someone that made a funny video about Trump.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Have you ever heard of libel? Oh my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think the one thing you've got to worry is when there are videos in which they can put you in a position with something that is a crime, like with a child where they can create -- that's the things we should be focusing on. Not these jokey videos, but the quote "deep fakes" in which you could be made to look like doing something, you're doing something horrible.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Nefarious. That's not good. Slander. I don't even know where -- a gut wrenching video of a helicopter rescue gone very wrong. If you haven't seen it, you won't believe it. That's next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: An unreal scene coming during a rescue of a 74-year-old woman.  Look at the gurney carrying the woman to safety. It starts to spin uncontrollably in midair as she is being lifted into a rescue helicopter.  The rescue happening after the woman reportedly fell during a hike at the Phoenix Mountain Preserve. Air turbulence from the helicopter's motor cause the gurney to spin out of control. The pilot insisting the woman did not suffer any ill effects from the mishap. And apparently the Phoenix folks said -- the Fire Department said they've done 210 helicopter hoist rescues, no problem. This woman apparently, she was a little bit dizzy, but she was fine, otherwise, Greg, how would you be?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can't even look at this. I'll tell you --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg would not be hiking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I would not be hiking, first of all. But you know what, I was just thinking, this is a great test for a psychopath. Like if you are looking at this and you are absolutely like, "Oh my God," then you're normal. But if you're looking at it and you're laughing and going, "Ha-ha-ha."  You're crazy. It's like -- I mean, I look at that and I can't even imagine. Jesse says --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Call me crazy because this looks fun to me. I mean, people pay money to go to Great Adventure and get spun around like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a 74-year-old.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wait, wait.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How do you know? I've seen a 74-year-olds at Great Adventure.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: With a head injury. Could you imagine if that was your grandmother with a head injury?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He can't, he's a psychopath. That's what I'm telling you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And if she wants to come on "Watters' World" this weekend and explain what happened, she'll be welcome to have her. But to a certain extent people that are thrill seekers to be strung up like that on a rescue there, twirled around 360 over and over the Grand Canyon.  That could be fun.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Falling off a cliff, people like cliff diving. Why not take her to Costa Rica and chuck her in the ocean?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's not unheard of that this actually happens in these rescue.  So maybe what you should do is start hiking. And then we can make -- trip you and see if you need a rescue and get you up there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I have a feeling you won't rescue me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I will rescue you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, you're going to push me down the Grand Canyon and watch me suffer.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: You've got to chew your own arm off.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You would, not Greg.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hey, by the way let me just say, she didn't buy into this. She didn't ask for this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, really?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How do you know?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I must say, looking at the video which I find you know, upsetting to my stomach. I would throw up in that situation I wonder if her head is exposed because if you can see, if your eyes are wide with fright and you're being zipped around that would make it even worse.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: No, she is strapped to a backboard, I guarantee.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think rescuers and first responders like this, they do incredible work under amazing difficult circumstances and you couldn't have gotten a vehicle to her in time in order to rescue her.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Did they know that she was being spun around? And if they did why didn't they go back down and stop it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They probably couldn't land it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because that would might have made it worse right? What if they - - what if you're spinning and you're trying to put her back down and then - -

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Then you can't fly with her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I like it, we're all experts. No, they should have landed that thing right over there and dropped her off.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They should have just stopped it from spinning.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: It looks a levitating spinning coffin.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was the name of my metal band.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Okay, so -- but when they finally get it up there and they can go forward, that's when this stops because of the physics or something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Someone is going to take that out of context.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Is there something? It's been one of those shows. Show them our commercial breaks. "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It is time now for "One More Thing," Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Okay, so yesterday we asked you to put your "Shut Up About Politics" songs up on our Facebook page and we gave kids permission to yell "shut up" and we want to thank everyone who sent in their videos. We have one we want to show. This is a video from Brittany and Brooke.  They're from New Jersey. They are very enthusiastic. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALES
utterances.sentences: We love THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And we love you. Send us your videos. We'll keep this going. I love it. Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's time for "Greg's Plugs." All right. Greg's Fox Nation show, "One Smart Person and Greg Gutfeld" features Kat Timpf. She will be talking about her new show, "Sincerely, Kat," which debuts on Fox Nation, June 13th, in which she gives advice to people. Isn't that funny? She gives advice. And now my podcast to piggyback on your thing, John Rich will be on my podcast tonight. Oh it's available now actually. So you go to foxnewspodcast.com and we discuss the success of the song and other -- in our future endeavors. What other songs we're going to do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, I love that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Was my appearance on your podcasts the most liked?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was, just as I disagree.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, so many of you guys missed me, not at this table, but on the air yesterday. I wasn't here. I was golfing with my father for a charity event that he holds every year at the Mill River Club out in Long Island for the Planting Fields Foundation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, you golf?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I do. And my dad generously let me win. Even though he tried to hit a nine wood of a sand trap that just was very embarrassing for everybody. There on the right is my caddy, or to the right of the screen that is Al de Blasio, no relation. And he gave me some great reads on the green and I shot a 90. No cheating. No mulligans. It was the first time I didn't cheat on the golf course.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Great score.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So there I am. And here I am tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a great story about your golf. Geez Louis.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But it was great that he did this with his dad.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's for charity, Greg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And you only play once a year.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, once a year. It's pretty good.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Give him some credit. Give him some credit.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I would wrestle a hobo to have a 90 in golf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go. I have wrestled a hobo, but for other things.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Okay, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right, so a North Carolina man has his granddaughter and a fortune cookie to thank for winning $344 million Powerball jackpot dollars. Take a look at him receiving the check.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's amazing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You heard me right, 66-year-old Charles Jackson, Jr. Got a fortune cookie from his granddaughter and after opening it, he decided to use the number on that little slip inside to guess the numbers of the Powerball and he got it right. Mr. Jackson at first, by the way, he thought he'd only 50 thousand bucks, but when he looked at the ticket again, he realized he got every number right. He won it all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why is he on TV? I would never be on TV if that happened. I would --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because everybody is coming after you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I would hide.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well he chose to claim, Greg, the $233 million lump payment and he said he is going to give a lot to charity. I think his granddaughter --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who is his charity person?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: He is a dancer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Those are the lumps you want to take.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, all right. By the way, I think the granddaughter gets to go to the ice cream parlor, you've got to do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Two scoops at least.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Amen. I just part of the Taj Mahal. Speaking of sweets, this story combines three things that I absolutely love -- cupcakes, capitalism, and Disney World. A sweet 14-year-old boy who has his own baking company, baked 3,500 cupcakes and sold them and they're really great. And then he took his entire family to Disney World. He raised $5,000.00, put so much effort, instead of claiming he was bored or asking for something or demanding a trip from his family, he figured out how much it was going to cost and he put so much hard work into it and they all had a wonderful time at the happiest place on earth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I love that. Kids that's a lesson and then record a video singing, "Shut Up About Politics."

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: With a cupcake in your mouth that you made yourself.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Democrats are probably going to shut them down because he didn't have a license to sell the cupcakes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Exactly right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know, he wasn't asking for a tax break like you Republican. He actually did the work. You've got tax breaks, too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, please.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Those cuff links, man. You're looking good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Never miss an episode of "The Five." "Special Report" is up next with Bret Baier. Content and Programming Copyright 2019 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
